message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper proposes a deep learning approach for enhancing the quality of compressed video by exploiting inter-frame correlation using a Quality-Gated Convolutional Long Short-Term Memory (QG-ConvLSTM) network with bi-directional recurrent structure. This involves learning the "forget" and "input" gates in the ConvLSTM cell from quality-related features to make the information of each frame reasonably and adequately used. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories are computer vision (cs.CV) and multimedia (cs.MM), as the paper deals with video quality enhancement using deep learning. The paper also involves learning from quality-related features, which suggests that it may fall under machine learning (cs.LG) and information retrieval (cs.IR) sub-categories.
